name: Herbed Beef Sukiyaki
description: Indulge in a Healthyfied version of Herbed Beef Sukiyaki, embracing the essence of low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar eating. This recipe brings out the robust flavors of lean sirloin, infused with a symphony of herbs and spices, making it a must-try dish for those who cherish Healthy Recipes.
recipeIngredient: 1  tsp(s) Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by thinly slicing the 400 grams of lean sirloin.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Mince 20 grams of garlic and chop 1 cup of white onions.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, combine the sliced sirloin with minced garlic, chopped onions, 1 tsp of sesame seeds, 1 tsp of marjoram, 1 tsp of oregano, and 1 tsp of ground black pepper. Mix well to ensure the beef is evenly coated with the seasonings.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tsp of sesame oil and 1 tsp of olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Once the oils are hot, add the beef mixture to the skillet. Stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes or until the beef is browned and cooked to your desired doneness.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Season the sukiyaki with 0.5 tsp of salt during the last couple of minutes of cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Herbed Beef Sukiyaki hot, garnished with additional sesame seeds if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
